{{about|the 21st century politician|the 20th century politician (his grandfather)|Karl Theodor Freiherr von und zu Guttenberg}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg | image = 2017-09-06 CSU KT zu Guttenberg 666 (cropped).JPG | office = [[Federal Ministry of Defence (Germany)|Federal Minister of Defence]] | chancellor = [[Angela Merkel]] | term_start = 28 October 2009 | term_end = 1 March 2011 | predecessor = [[Franz Josef Jung]] | successor = [[Thomas de Maizière]] | office2 = [[Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (Germany)|Federal Minister for Economic Affairs and Technology]] | chancellor2 = [[Angela Merkel]] | term_start2 = 10 February 2009 | term_end2 = 27 October 2009 | predecessor2 = [[Michael Glos]] | successor2 = [[Rainer Brüderle]] | office3 = [[Christian Social Union in Bavaria|Secretary General of the Christian Social Union]] | leader3 = [[Horst Seehofer]] | term_start3 = 3 November 2008 | term_end3 = 10 February 2009 | predecessor3 = Christine Haderthauer | successor3 = [[Alexander Dobrindt]] | office4 = [[Bundestag|Member of the Bundestag]]
for [[Kulmbach (electoral district)|Kulmbach]] | term_start4 = 22 September 2002 | term_end4 = 3 March 2011 | predecessor4 = Bernd Protzner | birth_name = Karl-Theodor Maria Nikolaus Johann Jacob Philipp Franz Joseph Sylvester Buhl-Freiherr von und zu Guttenberghttp://www1.wdr.de/stichtag/stichtag-guttenberg-doktortitel-100.htmlhttps://www.merkur.de/politik/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-wahrer-name-so-heisst-ehemalige-bundesminister-wirklich-6814825.html | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|12|5|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Munich]], [[West Germany]] | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Christian Social Union of Bavaria|Christian Social Union]] | spouse = [[Stephanie zu Guttenberg]] | alma_mater = [[University of Bayreuth]] | religion = [[Roman Catholicism in Germany|Roman Catholicism]] | signature = | successor4 = [[Emmi Zeulner]] }} '''Karl-Theodor Maria Nikolaus Johann Jacob Philipp Franz Joseph Sylvester Buhl-Freiherr von und zu Guttenberg''' (born 5 December 1971) is a [[Germans|German]] businessman and politician of the [[Christian Social Union in Bavaria|Christian Social Union]] (CSU). He served as a member of the [[Bundestag]] from 2002 to 2011, as Secretary-General of the CSU from 2008 to 2009, as [[Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (Germany)|Federal Minister for Economics and Technology]] in 2009 and as [[Federal Ministry of Defence (Germany)|Federal Minister of Defence]] from 2009 to 2011. After the discovery of plagiarism in his doctoral dissertation and the decision of the [[University of Bayreuth]] to revoke his doctorate, an affair known as [[Guttenberg plagiarism scandal]], he resigned from all political posts in March 2011. In 2011, Guttenberg joined the [[Center for Strategic and International Studies]] (CSIS). Guttenberg is the chairman and a founder of ''Spitzberg Partners'', an advisory and investment firm based in [[New York City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-133575505.html|title=Dr. Dotcom|language=German|publisher=Der Spiegel|date=2015-04-11|accessdate=2015-07-09}}{{cite web|url=http://www.br.de/nachrichten/guttenberg-usa-new-york-100.html|title=Das neue Leben des KT|language=German|publisher=Bayerischer Rundfunk|date=2015-05-27|accessdate=2015-07-09}} He returned to German politics during the [[German federal election, 2017|2017 federal election]] by making a speech which was widely described as a comeback. {{TOC limit}} == Education == In 1991, after finishing high school ([[Gymnasium (Germany)|Gymnasium]]) in [[Rosenheim]],{{cite web|url=http://www.wiwo.de/unternehmen-maerkte/koepfe-der-wirtschaft/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-926/biografie/|title=Köpfe der Wirtschaft: Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=WirtschaftsWoche|accessdate=2011-09-03}}{{cite web|url= http://www.ovb-online.de/lokales/rosenheim/landkreis/guttenberg-heimlicher-neubeurer-434454.html|title= Guttenberg: Heimlicher Neubeurer|language=German|publisher=Oberbayerisches Volksblatt|date=2009-02-10|accessdate=2011-09-03}} Guttenberg completed his mandatory military service reaching the rank of [[Sergeant]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rp-online.de/politik/deutschland/Der-Baron-uebernimmt-die-Bundeswehr_aid_773882.html|title=Der Baron übernimmt die Bundeswehr|language=German|publisher= Rheinische Post|date=2009-10-23|accessdate=2011-09-03}} Guttenberg studied [[law]] at the [[University of Bayreuth]],{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/portraet-der-herr-ist-so-frei_aid_371150.html|title=Der Herr ist so frei|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2009-02-16|accessdate=2011-09-03}} where he passed the first legal [[Staatsexamen|state examination]] (said to be the equivalent of a [[master's degree]]) in 1999. Guttenberg chose not to pursue the second state examination (the equivalent of a [[bar exam]]),{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/cmlink/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-die-studierstube-ist-seine-buehne-nicht-14431.html|title=Die Studierstube ist seine Bühne nicht|language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|date=2011-02-20|accessdate=2011-12-12}} and focused on running the Munich-based "Guttenberg GmbH" holding{{cite web|url= http://www.bild.de/politik/2009/minister/ist-millionaer-7361596.bild.html|title= Der neue Minister ist Millionär|publisher=Bild|language=German|date=2010-02-01|accessdate=2011-09-03}} where, along with a few employees, he managed his family's significant assets and various participations. Due to the holding's low turnover and small number of employees, it was said that Guttenberg had exaggerated his business experience.{{cite web|url=http://www.presseportal.de/pm/6561/1351881/ndr_norddeutscher_rundfunk|title="Panorama": Guttenberg übertrieb unternehmerische Erfahrung|language=German|publisher=NDR Norddeutscher Rundfunk|date=2009-02-12|accessdate=2011-11-26}} Guttenberg studied [[political science]] at the University of Bayreuth.{{cite web |url=http://www.spiegel.de/unispiegel/studium/plagiatsaffaere-doktorvater-wendet-sich-von-guttenberg-ab-a-748231.html |title=Plagiatsaffäre: Doktorvater wendet sich von Guttenberg ab |date=28 February 2011 |website=www.spiegel.de |publisher=Der Spiegel |access-date=29 March 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/peter-haeberle-zu-plagiats-affaere-doktorvater-revidiert-urteil-ueber-guttenberg-1.1066108 |title=Doktorvater revidiert Urteil über Guttenberg |date=28 February 2011 |website=www.sueddeutsche.de |publisher=Die Süddeutsche Zeitung |access-date=29 March 2015}} He successfully defended his thesis "Verfassung und Verfassungsvertrag. Konstitutionelle Entwicklungsstufen in den USA und der EU" ("Constitution and Constitutional Treaty. Stages of Constitutional Development in the USA and EU"), and was awarded the academic title [[Doctor of Law]] ("Doktor der Rechte") in 2007.{{cite web |url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/plagiats-affaere-uni-bayreuth-entzieht-guttenberg-den-doktortitel-a-747358.html |title=Plagiats-Affäre: Uni Bayreuth entzieht Guttenberg den Doktortitel |date=23 February 2011 |website=www.spiegel.de |publisher=Der Spiegel |access-date=29 March 2015}} Following accusations of plagiarism in Guttenberg's thesis, the University of Bayreuth conducted an investigation, culminating on 23 February 2011 with the revocation of Guttenberg's doctorate.{{cite web |url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2011-02/guttenberg-doktorarbeit-bayreuth |title=Universität kassiert Guttenbergs Doktortitel |date=23 February 2011 |website=www.zeit.de |publisher=Zeit Online |access-date=29 March 2015}} == Political career == [[File:Feierliches Gelöbnis.jpg|thumb|Guttenberg with [[Chancellor of Germany|German Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]], 2010]] Guttenberg is a member of the [[Christian Social Union of Bavaria|Christian Social Union of Bavaria (CSU)]] and held different positions within the party, including that of secretary general. === Member of Parliament === In [[German federal election, 2002|2002]], Guttenberg was elected to the [[Bundestag]] as the representative of [[Kulmbach (electoral district)|Kulmbach]]. He was reelected in [[German federal election, 2005|2005]], winning 60.0% of the votes in his constituency. In [[German federal election, 2009|2009]], he was reelected again with 68.1% of the votes in his district, obtaining the highest percentage of votes of all elected representatives in Germany for that election cycle.{{cite web |url=https://www.derwesten.de/nachrichten/politik/bundestagswahl/Guttenberg-erzielt-bundesweit-bestes-Wahlergebnis-id30254.html |title=Guttenberg erzielt bundesweit bestes Wahlergebnis|language=German| publisher=DerWesten.de |date=2009-09-28 }} From October 2005 to November 2008,{{cite web|url=http://www.wettendass.zdf.de/ZDFde/inhalt/2/0,1872,7900482,00.html|title=Stephanie und Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=ZDF|date=2009-10-03}} Guttenberg served as chairman of the [[CDU/CSU|CDU/CSU parliamentary group]] in the Bundestag's Foreign Affairs Committee{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/07/world/europe/07iht-germany.4509562.html|title=Germans agree to send 6 Tornado jets to Afghanistan|publisher=The New York Times|date=2007-02-07|accessdate=2015-07-09}} and as spokesman of the CDU/CSU parliamentary group in the Bundestag's Committee on disarmament, non-proliferation and arms control. He also chaired the CSU Foreign Policy Expert Committee{{cite web |url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/voelkermord-an-armeniern-csu-politiker-kritisieren-frankreichs-anti-tuerkei-politik-a-442515.html |title=CSU-Politiker kritisieren Frankreichs Anti-Türkei-Politik |language=German |publisher=Spiegel Online |date=2006-10-13|accessdate=2015-07-09}} and the German-British parliamentary group during that time.{{cite web|url=http://www.pressrelations.de/new/standard/result_main.cfm?pfach=1&n_firmanr_=109484&sektor=pm&detail=1&r=327222&sid=&aktion=jour_pm&quelle=0&profisuche=1 |title=Deutsch-Britische Parlamentariergruppe besucht England |language=German |publisher=Deutscher Bundestag |date=2008-06-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111001042339/http://www.pressrelations.de/new/standard/result_main.cfm?pfach=1&n_firmanr_=109484&sektor=pm&detail=1&r=327222&sid=&aktion=jour_pm&quelle=0&profisuche=1 |archivedate=October 1, 2011 }}{{cite web|url=http://news.alibaba.com/article/detail/markets/100189275-1-factbox-german-defence-minister-candidate-guttenberg.html|title=German defence minister candidate Guttenberg|date=2009-09-25|accessdate=2015-07-09}} ==== Political positions ==== In early 2004, Guttenberg introduced the concept of a [[Privileged partnership|Privileged Partnership]] between [[Turkey]] and the [[European Union]] as a viable alternative to [[accession of Turkey to the European Union]] into the German political discourse.{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/print-welt/article283505/Privilegierte_Partnerschaft.html|title=Privilegierte Partnerschaft|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2004-01-03|accessdate=2011-11-11}}{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2004/12/15/opinion/15iht-edgutten_ed3_.html|title=Preserving Europe : Offer Turkey a 'privileged partnership' instead|publisher=The New York Times|date=2004-12-15|accessdate=2011-11-11}} Guttenberg based his opposition to full Turkish membership in the EU on the country's insufficient fulfillment of relevant accession criteria,{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/article1047472/Union_bleibt_der_Tuerkei_gegenueber_kritisch.html|title=Union bleibt der Türkei gegenüber kritisch|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2007-07-23|accessdate=2011-11-11}} for example with regard to the [[Cyprus dispute]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wiwo.de/politik-weltwirtschaft/union-setzt-tuerkei-weiter-unter-druck-111573/|title=Union setzt Türkei weiter unter Druck|language=German|publisher=WirtschaftsWoche|date=2005-09-01|accessdate=2011-11-11}} At the same time, he stressed the necessity of maintaining good relations with Turkey and was therefore critical of a [[France|French]] initiative to criminalize the denial of the [[Armenian Genocide]].{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,442515,00.html|title=CSU-Politiker kritisieren Frankreichs Anti-Türkei-Politik|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2006-10-13|accessdate=2011-11-11}} Guttenberg also repeatedly warned of the looming threat posed to German and European security by [[Nuclear program of Iran|Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs]].{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article802737/Unionspolitiker_fuerchten_den_Iran.html|title=Unionspolitiker fürchten den Iran|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2007-04-10|accessdate=2011-11-11}} However, he rejected taking rash military action against [[Iran]] and instead called for an international diplomatic effort to deal with Tehran's nuclear program.{{cite web|url= http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,516113,00.html|title= Iran Crisis To Top Agenda of US Trip|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2007-11-08|accessdate=2011-11-11}}{{cite web|url= http://www.itnsource.com/shotlist//RTV/2010/02/08/RTV320310/|title= GERMANY: Defence Minister Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg denounces Iran's latest announcement that it will start to enrich fuel|publisher=ITN Source|date=2010-02-08|accessdate=2011-11-11}} As a Member of Parliament, he was a strong critic of the far-left party [[The Left (Germany)|Die Linke]], which he accused of links to [[terrorists]].{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/article2279846/Warum-Lafontaines-Linkspartei-gefaehrlich-ist.html |title=Warum Lafontaines Linkspartei gefährlich ist|language=German|publisher=Welt Online |date=2008-08-07 |accessdate=2011-09-07}} ==== Secretary General of the CSU ==== In September 2008, the CSU suffered heavy losses in the [[Bavaria state election, 2008|Bavaria state election]] and lost its absolute majority in the [[Landtag of Bavaria|Bavarian Landtag]] - for the first time in 46 years. As a result of this political defeat the CSU party leadership stepped down{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2008/09/30/uk-germany-csu-idUKTRE48T1TH20080930|title=Bavaria's CSU leader quits after election blow|publisher=Reuters|date=2008-09-30|accessdate=2011-07-12}}{{cite web| url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2008/10/01/uk-germany-csu-idUKTRE4903TQ20081001|title=Second CSU leader quits, raising risks for Merkel|publisher=Reuters|date=2008-10-01|accessdate=2011-07-12}} and [[Horst Seehofer]], the new CSU chairman and [[minister-president]] of Bavaria,{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aCOKp59WbZE8&refer=germany|title=Germany's Seehofer, Merkel Ally, Elected Bavarian State Premier|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2008-10-27|accessdate=2011-07-12}} appointed Guttenberg as [[secretary general]] of the CSU in November 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,587382,00.html|title=Guttenberg wird Seehofers Generalsekretär|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2008-10-30|accessdate=2017-11-14}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/10/30/world/europe/30iht-bavaria.4.17389046.html|title=Merkel's Bavarian allies go for a younger look|publisher=The New York Times|date=2008-10-30|accessdate=2011-07-12}} As secretary-general, Guttenberg called for tax cuts,{{cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/node/12724878|title=Merkel counts her blessings|publisher=The Economist|date=2008-12-04|accessdate=2011-07-12}}{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/steuersenkungen-csu-generalsekretaer-gibt-zielmarke-aus_aid_349723.html|title=CSU-Generalsekretär gibt Zielmarke aus|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2008-11-19|accessdate=2011-07-12}} an increase in family benefits and structural reforms within the CSU to foster more direct political participation of the party base.{{cite web|url=http://www.nordbayerischer-kurier.de/nachrichten/1278568/details_8.htm|title=Guttenberg gelobt neuen Politikstil|language=German|publisher=Nordbayerischer Kurier|date=2009-01-25|accessdate=2011-07-12}} In addition to domestic policy he also emphasized his focus on international affairs.{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/article2661283/Guttenberg-rechnet-mit-Schwarz-Gelb-im-Bund.html|title=Guttenberg rechnet mit Schwarz-Gelb im Bund|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2008-11-02|accessdate=2011-07-12}} === Federal Minister of Economics === After the resignation of [[Michael Glos]] on 9 February 2009{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/4562839/German-economics-minister-resigns.html|title=German economics minister resigns|publisher=The Telegraph|date=2009-02-08|accessdate=2011-07-13}} Guttenberg became [[Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology (Germany)|Federal Minister of Economics and Technology]] in the [[first Merkel cabinet]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7878585.stm|title=Germany gets new economy minister|publisher=BBC News|date=2009-02-09|accessdate=2011-07-12}}{{cite news|title=Guttenberg Sworn In as Economics Minister|url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,4022851,00.html|work=Deutsche Welle|date=2009-02-12|accessdate=2011-07-20}} Guttenberg, the youngest economics minister in the German post-war era,{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2009/02/09/uk-germany-guttenberg-profile-sb-idUKTRE5183WY20090209|title=FACTBOX - Germany's new Economy Minister Guttenberg|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-02-09|accessdate=2011-07-20}} came to office in the midst of a deep global [[Late-2000s financial crisis|financial crisis]] and [[Late-2000s recession|recession]]. In the wake of the global financial crisis, several major German banks were near failure, including [[Hypo Real Estate]], which received €102 billion of credit and guarantees from Germany's bank rescue fund.{{cite web | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/02/11/hyporealestate-guarantees-idUSLB10301220090211|title=Troubled Hypo takes more help from German govt|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-02-11|accessdate=2011-07-20}} In this case, Guttenberg opposed an overly hasty nationalization of Hypo Real Estate,{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/hypo-real-estate-csu-sperrt-sich-gegen-enteignung-654818.html|title=CSU sperrt sich gegen Enteignung|language=German|publisher=stern.de|date=2009-02-15|accessdate=2011-07-20}} which he considered only as "''ultissima ratio'', a measure of the very last resort".{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=alkNlCqLUl6s&refer=germany|title=Merkel Backs Hypo Majority Stake Over Nationalization|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-02-16|accessdate=2011-07-20}} A few months later he drafted a legislative proposal to minimize the financial risks of failing banks,{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=a.4adR2FxhRw|title=Germany’s Guttenberg Draws Up Bill to Prop Up Insolvent Banks|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-08-06|accessdate=2011-07-20}}{{cite web|url=https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2009/08/06/germany-prepares-new-rescue-methods-for-banks/|title=Germany Prepares New Rescue Methods for Banks|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-08-06|accessdate=2011-07-20}} which caused controversy{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/wirtschaft/soziales/0,1518,645090,00.html|title=SPD legt eigenes Gesetz zur Bankenrettung vor|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2009-08-26|accessdate=2011-07-20}} but later became the foundation of the German bank restructuring bill.{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2010/08/25/germany-banks-idUKLDE67O0Q620100825|title=German cabinet backs bank restructuring bill|publisher=Reuters|date=2010-08-25|accessdate=2011-07-20}}{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/wirtschaft/2010-08/bankenabgabe-kabinett|title=Regierung zwingt Banken zur Vorsorge|language=German|publisher=Zeit Online|date=2010-08-25|accessdate=2011-07-20}} In the case of troubled German companies asking for state aid, including automaker [[Opel]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dradio.de/aktuell/923694/|title=Guttenberg verlangt Zukunftskonzept von Opel|language=German|publisher=Deutschlandradio|date=2009-02-23|accessdate=2011-07-20}} and now-defunct mail-order service [[Arcandor|Arcandor/Quelle]],{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/feeds/afx/2009/06/03/afx6498316.html|title=Arcandor does not meet state aid criteria-EconMin|publisher=Forbes|date=2009-03-06|accessdate=2011-07-20}} Guttenberg was reluctant to commit government resources. He insisted on strict conditionality, including restructuring, and limited support to only those companies which were otherwise competitive but were temporarily affected by the crisis. In November 2008, Opel had appealed for governmental assistance because of severe financial problems facing its American parent, [[General Motors]] (GM).{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/0,1518,590906,00.html|title=As GM Falters, Opel Seeks Government Help|publisher=Spiegel Online International|date=2008-11-17|accessdate=2011-07-20}} In 2009, Opel employed 25,000 workers in Germany and indirectly supported 50,000 additional jobs through its supplier network. In March 2009, Guttenberg made his first visit to the US as economics minister, focusing his trip on the future of Opel.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/business/article/0,8599,1885112,00.html|title=Should Germany Help Bail Out GM?|publisher=Time|date=2009-03-14|accessdate=2011-07-20}} In his talks with [[United States Secretary of the Treasury|U.S. Treasury Secretary]] [[Timothy Geithner]], the director of the [[United States National Economic Council]], [[Lawrence Summers]], and [[Rick Wagoner]], then [[CEO]] of General Motors, Guttenberg demanded that GM provide a viable restructuring plan for Opel as a precondition for receiving financial assistance from the German state.{{cite web|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9F02E6DF143FF932A15750C0A96F9C8B63|title=German Aid for Opel Awaits Moves by G.M.|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-03-21|accessdate=2011-04-20}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/0f83a0e8-130a-11de-a170-0000779fd2ac.html#axzz1S54iPnHT|title=Germany ‘open’ to Opel rescue funds|publisher=Financial Times|date=2009-03-17|accessdate=2011-07-14}} Guttenberg and Wagoner agreed on the necessity of a private investor for Opel.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/03/21/gm-opel-investor-idINLL6820090321|title=German EconMin denies Opel has no serious bidders|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-03-21|accessdate=2011-07-20}} After Guttenberg's visit to the US, negotiations between the German government, GM, and potential Opel investors, including [[Fiat]] and Canada's [[Magna International]], were stalled by GM and the [[United States Department of the Treasury|U.S. Treasury]].{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/finanzen/news/auto-opel-rettung-in-der-schwebe-spitzentreffen-offen_aid_402516.html|title=Opel-Rettung in der Schwebe – Spitzentreffen offen|language=German|publisher=Fokus Money Online|date=2009-05-26|accessdate=2011-07-20}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/05/28/autos-gm-opel-idUSLS4261620090528|title=Opel talks end with no deal, Germany blames U.S.|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-05-28|accessdate=2011-07-20}} In contrast to Merkel and other German political leaders, Guttenberg preferred insolvency for Opel rather than the infusion of unconditional financial assistance from the German state.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aXvogfC1VANo|title=‘Orderly Insolvency’ Best Opel Option, Minister Says|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-05-25|accessdate=2011-07-20}} Because of the resultant financial risks to the German state, Guttenberg opposed the sale of Opel to Magna International, favoured by Chancellor Merkel,{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/money/autos/2009-05-29-gm-opel_N.htm|title=Merkel hails Magna plan to acquire Opel|publisher=USA Today|date=2009-05-30|accessdate=2011-07-20}} and—according to media coverage—even offered his resignation over the controversy.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/01/business/global/01opel.html|title=Effects of Opel Deal Ripple Across Europe|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-05-31|accessdate=2011-07-20}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/05/31/germany-opel-merkel-idUSLV9771320090531|title=Tensions rise in Merkel's coalition over Opel rescue|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-05-31|accessdate=2011-07-20}} The Opel-Magna deal later failed,{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/11/06/us-gm-opel-idUSTRE5A50DF20091106|title=Opel chief leaves following failed deal|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-11-06|accessdate=2011-07-20}} and Opel remained a subsidiary of GM, who had to reimburse financial assistance to Germany.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/11/24/us-gm-opel-idUSTRE5AN1B920091124|title=GM pays back Germany, signals fewer job cuts|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-11-24|accessdate=2011-07-20}} In the summer of 2009, he surpassed Angela Merkel as the most popular politician in Germany.{{cite news|url=http://www.fr-online.de/in_und_ausland/politik/aktuell/1850633_Guttenberg-zieht-an-Merkel-vorbei.html |title=Beliebteste Politiker: Guttenberg zieht an Merkel vorbei |language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Rundschau |date=2009-07-24 |accessdate=2011-02-18}} === Federal Minister of Defence === [[File:Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg in front of the Pentagon.JPG|thumb|upright|Karl-Theodor zu Guttenberg with U.S. Secretary of Defense [[Robert M. Gates]] in front of [[the Pentagon]], 2009]] The [[German federal election, 2009|2009 Bundestag elections]] led to a change in government, as the incumbent [[grand coalition]] of [[Christian Democratic Union (Germany)|CDU]]/[[Christian Social Union of Bavaria|CSU]] and [[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]] was replaced by a center-right coalition of CDU/CSU and [[Free Democratic Party (Germany)|FDP]].{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/09/27/AR2009092700631.html|title=Germany's Merkel Reelected, Will Form New Coalition|publisher=The Washington Post|date=2009-09-28|accessdate=2011-08-06}} According to German press reports, Chancellor Merkel offered Guttenberg the choice between the [[Federal Ministry of the Interior (Germany)|interior]] and the [[Federal Ministry of Defence (Germany)|defence]] ministries while negotiating the distribution of ministerial posts within the new coalition government.{{cite web|url=http://de.reuters.com/article/domesticNews/idDEBEE59M04R20091023|title=Kreise-Merkel stellt Guttenberg Innen oder Verteidigung zur Wahl|language=German|publisher=Reuters Deutschland|date=2009-10-23|accessdate=2011-08-06}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ka-news.de/region/karlsruhe/Umfrage-Welches-Ministerium-fuer-zu-Guttenberg-;art6066,290569 |title=Umfrage: Welches Ministerium für zu Guttenberg? |publisher=Ka-news.de |date=2009-10-24 |accessdate=2011-02-18}} Guttenberg decided to opt for the defence portfolio{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aBflR09Zv9ag|title=Guttenberg to Move From Economy to Defense Minister, DPA Says |publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-10-23|accessdate=2011-08-06}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/25/world/europe/25merkel.html|title=Merkel Picks Team to Govern in Germany|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-10-24|accessdate=2011-08-06}} and took the oath of office on 28 October 2009{{cite web|url=http://www.az-web.de/sixcms/detail.php?template=az_detail&id=1098640&_wo=News:Topnews&_g=Gerade-im-Amt,-schon-beim-Zapfenstreich|title=Gerade im Amt, schon beim Zapfenstreich |language=German|publisher=[[Aachener Zeitung]]|date=2009-10-30|accessdate=2011-08-06}} as part of the [[Second Cabinet Merkel]]. He was the youngest-ever German [[defence minister]] in the post-war era.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/0,1518,661124,00.html|title=Rising Star Guttenberg Embraces Difficult Defense Job|publisher=Spiegel Online International|date=2009-11-13|accessdate=2011-08-06}} ==== Afghanistan ==== The first political challenge facing defence minister Guttenberg was dealing with the [[2009 Kunduz airstrike|Kunduz airstrike]] of 4 September 2009. Initially, he adopted the position of his predecessor [[Franz Josef Jung|Jung]] and defended the air strike as "militarily appropriate". However, in contrast to Jung, Guttenberg conceded that the strike had also caused civilian casualties.{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/artikel/S31325/luftangriff-bei-kundus-guttenberg-militaerisch-angemessen-30077256.html|title=Guttenberg: "Militärisch angemessen"|language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|date=2009-11-06|accessdate=2011-08-06}} After Guttenberg had received additional information and investigative reports dating back to the tenure of his predecessor Jung, Guttenberg changed his position concerning the "Kunduz airstrike"{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/s/Rub0CCA23BC3D3C4C78914F85BED3B53F3C/Doc~EE8E18848093F488F85966D5BEF6DC8B7~ATpl~Ecommon~Sspezial.html|title=Guttenberg: "Militärisch nicht angemessen"|language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|date=2009-12-03|accessdate=2011-08-06}} and dismissed [[Bundeswehr]] [[Chief of Staff]] [[Wolfgang Schneiderhan (general)|Schneiderhahn]] and Parliamentary State Secretary of Defence Wichert on 26 November 2009.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/27/world/europe/27germany.html|title=German General Quits Over Airstrike|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-11-26|accessdate=2011-08-06}} Jung, who in the meantime had assumed the position of [[Federal Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs (Germany)|labor minister]] in the second Merkel cabinet, took full political responsibility for the delay in sharing relevant Kunduz air strike information and resigned the following day.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aqOtGzROkKek|title=German Minister Jung Quits on Afghan Air Strike|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-11-27|accessdate=2011-08-06}} At the demand of the opposition parties, the Bundestag subsequently established a special investigative committee to shed light on the defense ministry's communications policy in connection with the Kunduz air strike.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2009/12/03/germany-afghanistan-idINGEE5B22HE20091203|title=German parliament backs extension of Afghan mission|publisher=Reuters|date=2009-12-03|accessdate=2011-08-06}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/12/16/world/europe/16iht-germany.html|title=Pressure Builds on Merkel and Defense Minister Over NATO Bombing|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-12-15|accessdate=2011-08-06}} The final report of the Bundestag's special investigative committee cleared Guttenberg from the accusation that he had been responsible for the defence ministry's inadequate communications policy following the Kunduz strike.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,771983,00.html|title=Koalition entlastet Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-07-02|accessdate=2011-08-06}}{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/verteidigung-urteil-zur-kundus-affaere-guttenberg-unschuldig_aid_642309.html|title=Urteil zur Kundus-Affäre: Guttenberg unschuldig|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2011-07-02 |accessdate=2011-08-06}} The findings were supported by members from the ruling CDU/CSU-FDP coalition while the opposition parties criticized the special investigative committee's report{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/koalitions-bericht-zur-kundus-affaere-persilschein-fuer-guttenberg-1.1115279|title=Persilschein für Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Süddeutsche Zeitung|date=2011-07-02|accessdate=2011-08-06}} and later published their own account of the investigation.{{cite web|url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,15311961,00.html|title=German opposition condemns Kunduz airstrike as mistake|publisher=Deutsche Welle|date=2011-08-11|accessdate=2011-08-13}}{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/kundus-untersuchungsausschuss-politisch-nicht-angemessen-1715798.html|title=Politisch nicht angemessen|language=German|publisher=stern.de|date=2011-08-11|accessdate=2011-08-13}} Shortly after taking office, Guttenberg publicly compared the situation faced by Bundeswehr soldiers in [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|Afghanistan]] to "war".{{cite web|url=http://www.n24.de/news/newsitem_5565566.html|title=Guttenberg: Afghanistan-Einsatz ist für Soldaten Krieg|language=German|publisher=N24|date=2009-11-03|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://de.reuters.com/article/domesticNews/idDEBEE5A20IC20091103 |title=Guttenberg spricht von Krieg in Afghanistan|language=German|publisher=Reuters Deutschland|date=2009-11-03|accessdate=2011-08-10}}[http://www.thelocal.de/national/20100404-26311.html It's war, says Guttenberg], ''[[The Local]]'', 4 Apr 2010 In doing so, Guttenberg broke a major political taboo since up until then Germany's political leadership – including the Chancellor and previous defense ministers – had only referred to the Afghanistan intervention as a "stabilization deployment".{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/28/world/europe/28germany.html|title=German Minister Resigns Over Afghan Airstrike|publisher=The New York Times|date=2009-11-27|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/node/15954464|title=What is this thing called war?|publisher=The Economist|date=2010-04-22|accessdate=2011-08-10}} The new classification of the Bundeswehr's Afghanistan deployment as "war" improved the legal status of German soldiers operating under international law.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1978800,00.html|title=Germany Comes to Terms With Its New War|publisher=TIME World|date=2010-04-09|accessdate=2011-08-10}} [[File:Guttenberg in Kunduz Province in December 2009.jpg|thumb|left|Guttenberg in [[Kunduz Province]] in December 2009]] Guttenberg attempted to elevate public perception of Germany's Afghan mission by personally participating - sometimes along with the Chancellor - at funeral services held for fallen Bundeswehr soldiers.{{cite web|url=http://www.euronews.net/2010/04/24/merkel-mourns-german-troops-killed-in-afghanistan|title=Merkel mourns German troops killed in Afghanistan|publisher=euronews|date=2010-04-24|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/ausland/konflikte-report-politiker-verneigen-sich-vor-toten-soldaten_aid_501725.html|title=Report: Politiker verneigen sich vor toten Soldaten|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2010-04-24|accessdate=2011-08-10}} In November 2010, Guttenberg established the [[Combat Action Medal of the Bundeswehr]], which is awarded for bravery in combat and to soldiers who were the targets of terrorist or military attacks.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,728961,00.html|title=Guttenberg führt Kämpfer-Orden ein|language=German|publisher=Der Spiegel|date=2010-11-13|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/politik/deutschland/2010-11/bundeswehr-orden-gefecht|title=Tapferkeit im Gefecht wird zur soldatischen Tugend|language=German|publisher=Zeit Online|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.life.com/image/107193797|title=Bundeswehr Soldiers Receive Combat Medal|publisher=LIFE|date=2010-11-29|accessdate=2011-08-10}} At the political level, Guttenberg spoke out strongly against a military withdrawal from Afghanistan. He specifically warned against imposing fixed troop withdrawal timetables that do not take into account the security situation on the ground.{{cite web|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle08.asp?xfile=data/international/2010/February/international_February518.xml§ion=international|title=No concrete withdrawal date from Afghanistan|publisher=Khaleej Times Online|date=2010-02-10|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/29/world/europe/29germany.html|title=Germany Plans Start of Troop Withdrawal|publisher=The New York Times|date=2011-01-28|accessdate=2011-08-10}} Furthermore, Guttenberg also demanded a stronger involvement of key neighboring states such as Russia, India, and China in the resolution of the Afghan conflict.{{cite web|url=http://www.n-tv.de/politik/Guttenberg-will-NATO-Reform-article715950.html|title=Guttenberg will NATO-Reform|language=German|publisher=n-tv|date=2010-02-07|accessdate=2011-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.atimes.com/atimes/South_Asia/KL04Df03.html|title=Iran left out in the cold|publisher=Asia Times|date=2009-12-04|accessdate=2011-08-10}} In light of the traditionally challenging security situation in Afghanistan, Guttenberg called for the development of an internationally coordinated long-term security strategy – based on the use of special forces and close intelligence cooperation within the coalition – to stabilize the country even after the eventual withdrawal of all foreign troops.{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.de/national/20100705-28297.html|title=Tough summer ahead in Afghanistan, minister warns|publisher=The Local|date=2010-07-05|accessdate=2011-08-10}} During his tenure as defense minister, Guttenberg made nine visits to Afghanistan and the German soldiers deployed there.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=a9aj2wycyOT0|title=Germany’s Guttenberg Visits Afghanistan, Meets Troops, Karzai|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-11-12|accessdate=2011-08-13}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=a_kK8MBTbFOs|title=Germany’s Guttenberg Visits Afghanistan Amid Airstrike Fallout|publisher=Bloomberg|date=2009-12-11|accessdate=2011-08-13}} To gain a first-hand understanding of the situation on the ground and the military risks of the Bundeswehr's mission, Guttenberg went several times to the frontlines of the Afghan conflict.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/0,1518,714459,00.html|title=Guttenberg in der Gefechtszone|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2010-08-29|accessdate=2011-08-13}}{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/ausland/article10735902/Guttenberg-trifft-seine-Soldaten-an-der-Front.html|title=Guttenberg trifft seine Soldaten an der Front|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2010-11-04|accessdate=2011-08-13}} He also invited journalists to accompany him on these trips in an effort to educate the wider German public about the nature of the Bundeswehr deployment in Afghanistan.{{cite video|url=http://www.n-tv.de/mediathek/videos/politik/Guttenberg-besucht-Kampfgebiet-article1375241.html|medium = Television production|title=Guttenberg besucht Kampfgebiet|publisher=n-tv|language=German|date=2010-08-30|accessdate=2011-08-13}} In December 2010, Guttenberg traveled to Afghanistan along with his wife Stephanie to visit with the troops before the Christmas holidays.{{cite web|url=http://www.euronews.net/2010/12/13/german-minister-takes-wife-to-afghanistan/|title=German minister takes wife to Afghanistan|publisher=euronews|date=2010-12-13|accessdate=2011-08-13}} In addition, he was also accompanied by German TV moderator [[Johannes B. Kerner]],{{cite web|url= http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/0,1518,734230,00.html|title= Ehepaar Guttenberg zu Blitzbesuch in Kunduz eingetroffen|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2010-12-13|accessdate=2011-08-13}} who hosted his prime-time talk show at the Bundeswehr camp in [[Mazar-i-Sharif]] featuring the Guttenbergs and German soldiers deployed there.{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/fernsehen/article11681528/Kerner-Guttenberg-und-Advent-im-Kriegsgebiet.html|title=Kerner, Guttenberg und Advent im Kriegsgebiet|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2010-12-17|accessdate=2011-08-13}} While other German media and the opposition parties sharply criticized Guttenberg for allowing Kerner to host his show in Afghanistan,{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/ausland/afghanistan-besuch-die-guttenbergs-auf-dem-boulevard-1634169.html|title=Die Guttenbergs auf dem Boulevard|language=German|publisher=stern.de|date=2010-12-14|accessdate=2011-08-13}}{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/kultur/film/2010-12/kerner-guttenberg-afghanistan|title=Kerner erzählt vom Krieg|language=German|publisher=Zeit Online| date=2010-12-17|accessdate=2011-08-13}}{{cite web|url=http://www.swp.de/ulm/nachrichten/politik/Kritik-an-Guttenbergs-Afghanistan-Reise;art4306,765267|title=Kritik an Guttenbergs Afghanistan-Reise|language=German|publisher=Südwest Presse|date=2010-12-14|accessdate=2011-08-13}} the reaction by the German troops and the general public was predominantly positive.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/0,1518,734387,00.html|title=Opposition wettert gegen Guttenbergs "PR-Reise"|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2010-12-13|accessdate=2011-08-13}}{{cite web|url=http://www.domradio.de/aktuell/69974/die-soldaten-fanden-den-besuch-positiv.html|title=Die Soldaten fanden den Besuch positiv|language=German|publisher=domradio.de|date=2010-12-14|accessdate=2011-08-13}} ==== Bundeswehr reform ==== In early 2010, Guttenberg decided to push for fundamental Bundeswehr reforms in an effort to address the structural deficits within the German armed forces{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/0,1518,687458,00.html|title=Billig-Training vor dem tödlichen Einsatz|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2010-04-06|accessdate=2011-08-18}}{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/jahresbericht-zur-bundeswehr-mangel-und-missstand-an-allen-fronten-1551308.html|title=Mangel und Missstand an allen Fronten|language=German|publisher=stern.de|date=2010-03-16|accessdate=2011-08-18}} and to deal with declining defense budgets.{{cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/artikel/C30923/verteidigungsetat-guttenbergs-opferbereitschaft-30074342.html|title=Guttenbergs Opferbereitschaft|language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine|date=2010-06-02|accessdate=2011-08-18}} The overall goal was to boost the Bundeswehr's expeditionary capabilities{{cite web|url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/nationworld/2011587827_apeugermanymilitaryreform.html|title=German military could send more troops abroad|publisher=The Seattle Times|date=2010-04-12|accessdate=2011-08-18}} while, at the same time, achieving cost reductions. To accomplish these reforms, Guttenberg proposed to reduce the armed forces to 165,000 active duty soldiers and to suspend the [[Conscription|draft]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,5644876,00.html|title=German defense minister could abolish conscription in budget drive|publisher=Deutsche Welle|date=2010-06-03|accessdate=2011-08-18}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/08/24/world/europe/24iht-germany.html|title=Germany Plans Major Restructuring of Military|publisher=The New York Times|date=2010-08-23|accessdate=2011-08-18}}{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,2013076,00.html|title=Will the German Army Drop the Draft?|publisher=Time|date=2010-08-25|accessdate=2011-08-18}} resulting in the most comprehensive restructuring of the Bundeswehr since its founding in 1955.{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.de/politik/deutschland/bundeswehrreform-was-passiert-wenn-die-wehrpflicht-endet-1633092.html|title=Was passiert, wenn die Wehrpflicht endet|language=German|publisher=stern.de|date=2010-12-10|accessdate=2014-04-05}} Guttenberg's reform plans were supported by a blue-ribbon "Bundeswehr Structural Commission"{{cite web|url=http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/blogs/defense/index.jsp?plckController=Blog&plckScript=blogScript&plckElementId=blogDest&plckBlogPage=BlogViewPost&plckPostId=Blog:27ec4a53-dcc8-42d0-bd3a-01329aef79a7Post:c641f957-724d-4c7b-98dd-fbe9d82940d5|title=Restructuring Recommendations|publisher=Aviation Week|date=2010-10-27|accessdate=2011-08-18}} that the minister created in April 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.defpro.com/daily/details/549/|title=Committee established to tailor Bundeswehr structure to future requirements|publisher=Defence Professionals|date=2010-04-14|accessdate=2011-08-18}} The proposals triggered a major debate about the country's draft system and were met with significant political opposition, not least in Guttenberg's own political party.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/0,1518,708905-3,00.html|title=Conscription Debate Divides German Conservatives|publisher=Spiegel Online International|date=2010-07-29|accessdate=2011-08-18}} In the end, Guttenberg's view won out and on 29 October 2010, the CSU general party convention approved the minister's motion to suspend the draft by a large majority.{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,726239,00.html|title=CSU stimmt für Aussetzung der Wehrpflicht|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2010-10-29|accessdate=2011-08-18}} Several weeks later, Chancellor Merkel's CDU held its own party convention and also voted in favor of suspending the draft.{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/politik/deutschland/parteien-cdu-stimmt-fuer-aussetzung-der-wehrpflicht_aid_572412.html|title=CDU stimmt für Aussetzung der Wehrpflicht|language=German|publisher=Focus Online|date=2010-11-15|accessdate=2011-08-18}} In November 2010, a [[United States diplomatic cables leak]] revealed that American diplomats viewed Guttenberg positively, with one cable describing him as a "foreign policy expert, a [[Transatlanticism|transatlanticist]] and a close and well-known friend to the United States".[http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/0,1518,731645-3,00.html How America Views the Germans] 30 November 2010 === Plagiarism scandal and resignation === {{Main|Guttenberg plagiarism scandal}} In 2011, Guttenberg resigned amid controversy over his dissertation. The first accusations of [[plagiarism]] in Guttenberg's dissertation were made public in February 2011. Guttenberg's doctoral dissertation, "Verfassung und Verfassungsvertrag" ("Constitution and Constitutional Treaty"), had been the basis of his 2007 Doctorate from the [[University of Bayreuth]].{{cite news |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/guttenbergs-doktorarbeit-summa-cum-laude-mehr-als-schmeichelhaft-1.1060779 |title=Summa cum laude? – "Mehr als schmeichelhaft"|author=Roland Preuß|work=sueddeutsche.de |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-02-22}}{{cite news|author=Roland Preuß and Tanjev Schultz |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/plagiatsvorwurf-gegen-verteidigungsminister-guttenberg-soll-bei-doktorarbeit-abgeschrieben-haben-1.1060774 |title=Plagiatsvorwurf gegen Verteidigungsminister: zu Guttenberg soll bei Doktorarbeit abgeschrieben haben|work=sueddeutsche.de |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-02-21}} Guttenberg at first denied intentional plagiarism, calling the accusations "absurd," but acknowledged that he may have made errors in his footnotes.{{cite news |url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,745919,00.html |title=Fußnoten-Streit: Dr. Guttenberg nennt Plagiatsvorwürfe abstrus|work=Spiegel Online |date=2011-02-16 |accessdate=2011-02-21}}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-12489762 |title=German minister denies plagiarism on PhD thesis |publisher=BBC News |date=2011-02-17 |accessdate=2016-11-21}}{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/mar/01/german-defence-minister-resigns-plagiarism |title=German defence minister resigns in PhD plagiarism row |author=Helen Pidd |publisher=The Guardian |date=2011-03-01 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} In addition, it emerged that Guttenberg had requested a report from the Bundestag's research department, which he had then inserted into his thesis without attribution.{{cite news |url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/plagiarism-accusations-widen-guttenberg-copied-work-of-german-parliament-s-research-department-a-746573.html |title=Plagiarism Accusations Widen: Guttenberg Copied Work of German Parliament's Research Department |publisher=Spiegel Online |date=2011-02-19 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} On 23 February 2011, Guttenberg apologized in [[Bundestag (Germany)|parliament]] for flaws in his thesis, but denied intentional deception and denied the use of a ghostwriter.{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-germany-minister-plagiarism-idUKTRE71M4JY20110223 |title=German minister admits mistakes in plagiarism row |author=Erik Kirschbaum |publisher=Reuters |date=2011-02-23 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} On 23 February 2011, the University of Bayreuth withdrew Guttenberg's doctorate.{{cite news|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,747358,00.html|title=Uni Bayreuth entzieht Guttenberg den Doktortitel|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-02-23|accessdate=2012-02-01}}{{cite news |url=http://www.dw.com/en/german-defense-minister-loses-doctorate-amid-plagiarism-scandal/a-14860585 |title=German defense minister loses doctorate amid plagiarism scandal |publisher=Deutsche Welle |date=2011-02-23 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} In part due to the expressions of confidence by Angela Merkel, the scandal continued to evoke heavy criticism from prominent academics, legal scholars (who accused Guttenberg of intentional plagiarism), and politicians both in the opposition and in the governing coalition.{{cite news|author=Rudolf Neumaier |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/politik/plagiatsaffaere-um-guttenberg-wir-sind-einem-betrueger-aufgesessen-1.1065263 |title=Plagiatsaffäre um Guttenberg "Einem Betrüger aufgesessen"|work=sueddeutsche.de |date=2011-02-26 |accessdate=2011-03-01}}{{cite news |url=https://www.handelsblatt.com/politik/deutschland/plagiatsaffaere-juristen-unterstellen-guttenberg-vorsatz/3886578.html |title=Plagiatsaffäre: Juristen unterstellen Guttenberg Vorsatz |publisher=Handelsblatt |date=2011-02-26 |accessdate=2016-11-21}}{{cite news |url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/plagiarism-affair-defense-minister-guttenberg-resigns-a-748330.html |title=Plagiarism Affair: Defense Minister Guttenberg Resigns |publisher=Spiegel Online |date=2011-03-01 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} On 1 March 2011, Guttenberg announced his resignation as Minister of Defense, from his seat in the Bundestag, and from all other political offices.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-germany-guttenberg-idUSTRE7201WI20110301 |title=German defense minister quits in plagiarism row |author=Erik Kirschbaum |publisher=Reuters |date=2011-03-01 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} In May 2011, a University of Bayreuth commission tasked with investigating Guttenberg's dissertation came to the conclusion that Guttenberg had engaged in intentional deception in the writing of his dissertation, and had violated standards of good academic practice.{{cite news |url=http://www.spiegel.de/lebenundlernen/uni/abschlussbericht-in-bayreuth-guttenberg-gibt-familie-mitschuld-an-doktorschmu-a-761868.html |title=Abschlussbericht in Bayreuth: Guttenberg gibt Familie Mitschuld an Doktorschmu |publisher=Spiegel Online |date=2011-05-11 |accessdate=2016-11-21}}{{cite news |url=http://www.dw.com/en/university-says-ex-defense-minister-deliberately-cheated-on-thesis/a-15056863 |title=University says ex-defense minister 'deliberately cheated' on thesis |publisher=Deutsche Welle |date=2011-05-06 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} The commission found that he had included borrowed passages throughout his thesis, without citation, and had modified those passages in order to conceal their origin.{{cite news |url=https://www.welt.de/politik/deutschland/article13365134/Uni-Bayreuth-weist-Guttenbergs-Beteuerungen-zurueck.html |title=Uni Bayreuth weist Guttenbergs Beteuerungen zurück |publisher=Die Welt |date=2011-05-11 |accessdate=2016-11-21}}{{cite news |url=http://www.badische-zeitung.de/deutschland-1/uni-bayreuth-guttenberg-hat-vorsaetzlich-getaeuscht--45177077.html |title=Uni Bayreuth: Guttenberg hat vorsätzlich getäuscht |publisher=Badische Zeitung |date=2011-05-12 |accessdate=2016-11-21}} In November 2011, the prosecution in [[Hof, Bavaria|Hof]] discontinued the criminal proceedings for copyright violations against Guttenberg on condition of Guttenberg paying €20,000 to a charity. The prosecutor found 23 prosecutable copyright violations in Guttenberg's dissertation, but estimated that the material damage suffered by the authors of those texts was marginal.{{cite news |url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/ermittlungen-in-plagiatsaffaere-eingestellt-guttenberg-kommt-glimpflich-davon-1.1197275 |title=Guttenberg kommt glimpflich davon |publisher=[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]] |date=2011-11-23 |accessdate=2016-11-24}}{{cite news |url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/prosecutors-drop-case-against-german-ex-minister-113344146.html |title=Prosecutors drop case against German ex-minister |publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] |agency=[[Associated Press]] |author=Geir Moulson |date=2011-11-23 |accessdate=2016-11-24}} The doctorate affair also led to scrutiny of other politicians' doctorates, notably that of his colleague in the federal cabinet [[Annette Schavan]] and Hungarian President [[Pál Schmitt]], who lost their doctorates for similar reasons. == Post-resignation career == In September 2011, Guttenberg joined the [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]]-based [[Center for Strategic and International Studies]] (CSIS).{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/news/2011-09/29/politik-guttenberg-schliesst-sich-us-thinktank-an-29170607|title= Guttenberg schließt sich US-Thinktank an|language=German|publisher=Zeit Online|date=2011-09-29|accessdate=2011-09-29}} At the [[Halifax International Security Forum]] in November 2011, Guttenberg made his first public appearance since joining CSIS.{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.de/politics/20111120-38983.html|title=Guttenberg attacks former colleagues|publisher=The Local|date=2011-11-20|accessdate=2011-11-22}} During a plenary session on the economic and financial crisis he voiced pessimism about the current state of the EU{{cite web|url=https://www.welt.de/politik/article13725817/Guttenbergs-grosser-Pessimismus-in-der-Euro-Krise.html|title=Guttenbergs großer Pessimismus in der Euro-Krise|language=German|publisher=Welt Online|date=2011-11-20|accessdate=2011-11-22}} and decried a severe "crisis of political leadership".{{cite web|url=http://www.abendblatt.de/politik/deutschland/article2100075/Guttenberg-prangert-Fuehrungskrise-an.html|title=Guttenberg prangert Führungskrise an|language=German|publisher=Hamburger Abendblatt|date=2011-11-21|accessdate=2011-11-22}} In November 2011, Guttenberg published the book ''"Vorerst gescheitert"'' ("Failed for Now"). The publication is based on a series of conversations with the [[editor-in-chief]] of [[Die Zeit]], [[Giovanni di Lorenzo]], in which Guttenberg talks extensively for the first time about his political career, the [[Causa Guttenberg|plagiarism scandal]] and his resignation, as well as his plans for the future.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/24/idINIndia-60716820111124|title=Fallen German conservative star ready for comeback|publisher=Reuters|date=2011-11-24|accessdate=2012-01-12}} Guttenberg's criticism in the book of the direction which the CSU is headed sparked some controversy within his party.{{cite web|url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/karriere/guttenberg-buch-ueber-plagiatsaffaere-ich-bin-kein-blender-und-betrueger-1.1221178| title=Ich bin kein Blender und Betrüger|language=German|publisher=Sueddeutsche Zeitung Online|date=2011-11-29|accessdate= 2011-12-06}}{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,801542,00.html|title=Nicht nötig, uns eine mitzugeben|language=German|publisher=SPIEGEL Online|date=2011-12-03|accessdate=2011-12-06}} Guttenberg is a strong critic of [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]]'s expansionist foreign policy. In Spring 2014, he decried an "astonishing leadership vacuum in the world" and demanded that the West, and especially Europe, respond to Moscow's aggressions with strong political action. He praised Chancellor Merkel for her firm stance against Putin. Guttenberg appeared together with [[Henry Kissinger]] during a CNN interview about the [[2013–15 Ukrainian crisis|Ukraine crisis]] and explained the significant domestic political resistance that Merkel's Russia policy faced in Germany.{{cite web|url=http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2014/05/11/kissinger-on-russias-global-integration/|title=Kissinger on Russia's global integration|publisher=CNN|date=2014-05-11|accessdate=2015-02-12}} Several months later Guttenberg accused the EU of inaction and a lack of capabilities given the crises in [[Ukraine]] and the [[Middle East]].{{cite web|url=https://online.wsj.com/articles/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-the-return-of-europes-sleepwalkers-1409786698|title=The Return of Europe's Sleepwalkers|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|date=2014-09-03|accessdate=2015-02-12|subscription=yes}} In spring 2014, Guttenberg formed Spitzberg Partners LLC, a consulting and investment company.{{cite web|url=http://www.capital.de/meinungen/putins-strategie-durchkreuzen.html|title=Putins Stragie durchkreuzen|language=German|publisher=Capital|date=2014-03-11|accessdate=2014-05-21}} In September 2014, Spitzberg Partners and Canadian Acasta Capital{{cite web|url=http://www.focus.de/finanzen/diverses/aussenhandel-neue-beratungspartnerschaft-unterstuetzt-europaeische-und-kanadische-unternehmen-beim-ausbau-ihrer-wirtschaftsbeziehungen_id_4156970.html|title=Außenhandel: Neue Beratungspartnerschaft unterstützt europäische und kanadische Unternehmen beim Ausbau ihrer Wirtschaftsbeziehungen|language=German|publisher=Spitzberg Partners|date=2014-09-24|accessdate=2015-08-27}} founded ''Atlantic Advisory Partners'' (AAP), a partnership to promote business and trade between [[Canada]] and the [[European Union]] in connection with the [[Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement]] (CETA).{{cite web|url=http://www.wiwo.de/politik/europa/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg-ex-minister-soll-das-eu-handelsabkommen-ceta-retten/11773300.html|title=Ex-Minister soll das EU-Handelsabkommen CETA retten|language=German|publisher=WirtschaftsWoche|date=2015-05-15|accessdate=2015-08-27}} As a part of diplomatic outreach, Guttenberg and [[Karin Olofsdotter (diplomat)|Karin Olofsdotter]] were part of a town hall style meeting in Peters Township, south of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.{{cite web | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/the-swedish-ambassadors-searches-for-answers-in-trump-country/2017/11/05/6aab69be-bfe1-11e7-8444-a0d4f04b89eb_story.html | title=The Swedish ambassador’s search for answers in Trump country | publisher=Washington Post | date=5 November 2017 | accessdate=8 December 2017}} ==Political comeback== Guttenberg returned to German politics by making a speech during the [[German federal election, 2017]] in which he hailed Chancellor Angela Merkel. The speech was widely reported on in German media and described as marking his comeback in German politics. Guttenberg also said Germany should preserve its relationship with the United States in order to renew the ties after the end of the Trump era, noting that "they won’t forget it if, at a time when they were being mocked by the whole world, we maintained contacts with them and said this relationship is important now and will remain so in future."[https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-germany-election-guttenberg/ovation-for-merkel-ally-guttenberg-on-his-political-come-back-idUKKCN1BA2MI Ovation for Merkel ally Guttenberg on his political come-back], Reuters == Family and personal life == [[File:Stephanie zu Guttenberg-2010.jpg|thumb|upright|[[Stephanie zu Guttenberg]], née Gräfin von Bismarck-Schönhausen, the wife of Guttenberg (2010)]] Guttenberg is a member of the [[House of Guttenberg]], first documented in 1158, and conferred the rank of [[baron]] by the [[Holy Roman Emperor]] in 1700.Genealogisches Handbuch des in Bayern immatrikulierten Adels, Vol. XXV, 2004, p. 422. Further information about zu Guttenberg's family is also based on this source. Since the adoption of Germany's 1919 [[Weimar Constitution]], which abolished the nobility's privileges, "noble titles form part of the name only".Article 109 of the [[Weimar Constitution]] His grandfather, Karl Theodor Freiherr von und zu Guttenberg (1921–1972), was a CSU politician and hard-line conservative during the [[Cold War]], noted for his opposition to the [[Ostpolitik]]. During the [[World War II|Second World War]], he narrowly escaped execution after refusing to kill [[Jews]], stating that he would rather shoot [[Schutzstaffel|SS members]].{{ cite web|url=http://www.faz.net/themenarchiv/feuilleton/bilder-und-zeiten/enoch-zu-guttenberg-ploetzlich-kennt-man-ihn-als-vater-1969501.html|title=Plötzlich kennt man ihn als Vater|language=German|publisher=Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|date=2010-04-27|accessdate=2013-06-06}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesspiegel.de/medien/mit-schloss-und-ross-die-musterfamilie/3089268.html|title=Die Musterfamilie|language=German|publisher=Der Tagesspiegel|date=2010-11-21|accessdate=2013-06-06}} Several other members of Guttenberg's family also offered [[German Resistance to Nazism|resistance to the Nazi regime]], among them his great-grandfather Georg Enoch Freiherr von und zu Guttenberg,{{cite web|url=http://www.zeit.de/2009/31/Die-Guttenbergs/komplettansicht|title=Adel macht Eindruck|language=German|date=2009-07-26|accessdate=2013-06-06}} and [[Karl Ludwig Freiherr von und zu Guttenberg]], a great-great-uncle of Guttenberg. Karl Ludwig was a Catholic monarchist, who prior to the Second World War published the "Weiße Blätter" (White Papers), an important publication of the conservative opposition to the Nazi regime. He belonged to the circle of anti-Hitler conspirators around [[Hans von Dohnányi]], Justus Delbrück, and [[Hans Oster]]. After the failure of the [[20 July plot]] he was arrested and later executed.{{cite web|url=http://www.kas.de/wf/doc/kas_6713-544-1-30.pdf|title=Der Widerstand gegen den Nationalsozialismus und die Wurzeln christlich-demokratischer Politik|language=German|date=2005-05-24|accessdate=2013-06-06}} His grandmother, Rosa Sophie Prinzessin von Arenberg (1922-2012), was a member of the [[House of Arenberg]]. [[File:Guttenberg.JPG|thumb|The family castle in [[Guttenberg, Bavaria]]]] Guttenberg was born in [[Munich]]. He lived at his family castle in [[Guttenberg, Bavaria|Guttenberg]], [[Bavaria]] (district of Kulmbach), a village whose history is closely associated with the [[House of Guttenberg]], and in a mansion in a refined part of Berlin, Berlin-Westend. The castle has been in the possession of the Guttenberg family since 1482.{{cite news |first=Britta |last=Frischemeyer |authorlink= |author2=Topar, Julia |title=Der adelige Senkrechtstarter |url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/news/politik/2009/02/09/karl-theodor-zu-guttenberg/hg-portrait-karl-theodor/zu-guttenberg-der-adelige-senkrechtstarter.html |publisher=Bild |date=2009-02-09 |accessdate=2011-08-18 }} Guttenberg's father was [[Enoch zu Guttenberg]], a conductor,{{cite web|url=http://www.bach-cantatas.com/Bio/Guttenberg-Enoch-zu.htm|title=Enoch zu Guttenberg (Conductor)|publisher=Bach Cantatas Website|date=July 2001|accessdate=2011-11-10}} who has been decorated with the [[Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany|Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany (Officer's Cross)]]{{cite web|url= http://www.wdk-koeln.de/kuenstler.php?Kuenstler_ID=25|title= Enoch zu Guttenberg|language=German|publisher=Westdeutsche Konzertdirektion Köln|accessdate=2011-09-14}} as well as the [[Bavarian Order of Merit]]. He has received many awards for his contributions to classical music, including the German Cultural Award and the [[Echo (music award)|Echo Klassik]] award.{{cite web|url= http://www.nordbayerischer-kurier.de/nachrichten/1272823/details_341.htm.|title= Anerkennung in der Höhle des Löwen|language=German|publisher=Nordbayerischer Kurier|date=2008-06-24|accessdate=2011-09-14}}
Previously, Enoch zu Guttenberg also owned the winery estate [[Weingut Reichsrat von Buhl]].{{cite web|url= http://www.nordbayerischer-kurier.de/nachrichten/1280098/details_8.htm|title= Vater Guttenberg erhofft sich vom Sohn Umweltschutzinitiativen|language=German|publisher=Nordbayerischer Kurier|date=2009-03-19|accessdate=2011-09-14}} Guttenberg's mother, Christiane zu EltzHis mother's full name in German is ''Maria de Mercedes Christiane Josefine Thekla Walpurga Barbara Gräfin und Edle Herrin von und zu Eltz genannt Faust von Stromberg'' is a member of the [[Eltz]] family, which has strong ties with [[Croatia]]. She is the daughter of Ludwine, Countess [[Pejacsevich]] de Verocze. Her father was [[Jakob von und zu Eltz]], a former President of the Association of Winemakers in [[Rheingau]] who became active in Croatian politics after Croatian independence. She divorced Enoch zu Guttenberg in 1977, and Karl-Theodor grew up with his father. His mother married secondly Adolf Richard Barthold von Ribbentrop, owner of an [[Eltville]] art gallery and son of [[Joachim von Ribbentrop]], in 1985, and has two children from her second marriage.{{cite web|url=http://thepeerage.com/p4538.htm |title=entry on Christiane Gräfin und Edle Herrin von und zu Eltz genannt Faust von Stromberg |publisher=Thepeerage.com |accessdate=2011-03-01}} Guttenberg has a younger brother, Philipp Franz zu Guttenberg (born 1973), who married a daughter of Godfrey James Macdonald, the 8th [[Baron Macdonald]]. In February 2000, Guttenberg married [[Stephanie zu Guttenberg|Stephanie Gräfin von Bismarck-Schönhausen]] (born 1976),{{cite news| url=http://www.time.com/time/business/article/0,8599,1885112,00.html | work=Time | title=Should Germany Help Bail Out GM? | date=14 March 2009 | accessdate=7 May 2010}} a great-great-granddaughter of the first Chancellor of Germany [[Otto von Bismarck]]. They have two daughters. Guttenberg is [[Catholic]], while his wife is [[Evangelical Church in Germany|Protestant]] ([[Evangelical Lutheran Church in Bavaria|Lutheran]]).{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} In September 2011, it became known that Guttenberg had bought a house for his family in [[Greenwich, Connecticut|Greenwich (Connecticut)]], close to [[New York City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/0,1518,785483,00.html|title=Guttenberg kauft Millionenanwesen nahe New York|language=German|publisher=Spiegel Online|date=2011-09-10|accessdate=2011-09-20}} {{ahnentafel |collapsed=yes |align=center |boxstyle_1=background-color: #fcc; |boxstyle_2=background-color: #fb9; |boxstyle_3=background-color: #ffc; |boxstyle_4=background-color: #bfc; |boxstyle_5=background-color: #9fe; |1= 1. '''Karl Johann Bernhard Karsten''' (26 November 1782 – 22 August 1853) was a [[Germany|German]] [[mineralogist]] known for contributions made to the German [[metallurgy]] industry.
==Biography== He was born at [[Bützow]] in [[Duchy of Mecklenburg-Schwerin|Mecklenburg-Schwerin]] and initially studied law in [[University of Rostock|Rostock]]. From 1801 he devoted his time to mining and metallurgy. In 1819 he was named mining councilor to the Ministry of the Interior in [[Berlin]]. He was a major factor in the emergence of the [[zinc]] industry in [[Silesia]].<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=mQNJAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA119&lpg=PA119&dq=%22Karsten,+Karl+Johann+Bernhard%22+1782&source=bl&ots=v2FxNEOdRw&sig=Mc4_6qw1f6k4MTc_rZEymjj6azU&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiJyKGE_9vJAhWSoIMKHZy0AK0Q6AEITTAI#v=onepage&q=%22Karsten%2C%20Karl%20Johann%20Bernhard%22%201782&f=false The New International Encyclopedia, Volume 13] edited by Frank Moore Colby, Talcott Williams</ref>
He was author of several comprehensive works, including: * ''Handbuch der Eisenhüttenkunde'' (2 volumes, 1816; 3rd edition, 1841). * ''System der Metallurgie, geschichtlich, statistisch, theoretisch und technisch'' (5 volumes, with atlas, 1831-1832). * ''Lehrbuch der Salinenkunde'' (2 volumes, 1846-1847).
He was well known as editor of the ''Archiv für Bergbau und Hüttenwesen'' (Archive for mining and metallurgy; 20 volumes, 1818-1831); and (with [[Ernst Heinrich Karl von Dechen]]) of the ''Archiv für Mineralogie, Geognosie, Bergbau und Hüttenkunde'' (26 volumes, 1829-1854).<ref>[https://de.wikisource.org/wiki/ADB:Karsten,_Karl_Johann_Bernhard ADB:Karsten, Karl Johann Bernhard] [[Allgemeine Deutsche Biographie]]</ref>
He died at [[Berlin]] in 1853. His son, Dr. [[Hermann Karsten (physicist)|Hermann Karsten]] (1809-1877), was a professor of [[mathematics]] and [[physics]] at the [[University of Rostock]].

At the 1912 [[International Congress of Mathematicians]], [[Edmund Landau]] listed four basic problems about [[prime number]]s. These problems were characterised in his speech as "unattackable at the present state of mathematics" and are now known as '''Landau's problems'''. They are as follows: # [[Goldbach's conjecture]]: Can every even integer greater than 2 be written as the sum of two primes? # [[Twin prime conjecture]]: Are there infinitely many primes ''p'' such that ''p'' + 2 is prime? # [[Legendre's conjecture]]: Does there always exist at least one prime between consecutive [[Square number|perfect squares]]? # Are there infinitely many primes ''p'' such that ''p'' − 1 is a perfect square? In other words: Are there infinitely many primes of the form ''n''<sup>2</sup> + 1?
{{As of|2018}}, all four problems are unresolved.
==Progress toward solutions==
===Goldbach's conjecture=== [[Vinogradov's theorem]] proves [[Goldbach's weak conjecture]] for sufficiently large ''n''. In 2013 [[Harald Helfgott]] proved the weak conjecture for all odd numbers greater than 5.<ref>{{cite arXiv |eprint=1305.2897 |title = Major arcs for Goldbach's theorem|last = Helfgott|first = H.A. |class=math.NT |year=2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite arXiv |eprint=1205.5252 |title = Minor arcs for Goldbach's problem |last = Helfgott|first = H.A.|class=math.NT |year=2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite arXiv |eprint=1312.7748 |title = The ternary Goldbach conjecture is true|last = Helfgott|first = H.A. |class=math.NT |year=2013}}</ref> Unlike [[Goldbach's conjecture]], Goldbach's weak conjecture states that every odd number greater than 5 can be expressed as the sum of three primes. Although Goldbach's strong conjecture has not been proven or disproven, its proof would imply the proof of Goldbach's weak conjecture.
[[Chen's theorem]] proves that for all sufficiently large ''n'', <math>2n=p+q</math> where ''p'' is prime and ''q'' is either prime or [[semiprime]]. [[Hugh Montgomery (mathematician)|Montgomery]] and [[Robert Charles Vaughan (mathematician)|Vaughan]] showed that the exceptional set (even numbers not expressible as the sum of two primes) was of [[Natural density|density]] zero.<ref>{{cite journal |first=H. L. |last=Montgomery |last2=Vaughan |first2=R. C. |url=http://matwbn.icm.edu.pl/ksiazki/aa/aa27/aa27126.pdf |title=The exceptional set in Goldbach's problem |journal=Acta Arithmetica |volume=27 |issue= |year=1975 |pages=353–370 |doi= }}</ref>
In 2015 Tomohiro Yamada proved an explicit version of Chen's theorem:<ref>{{cite arXiv|last=Yamada |first=Tomohiro |eprint=1511.03409 |title=Explicit Chen's theorem |class=math.NT |date=2015-11-11}}</ref> every even number greater than <math>e^{e^{36}} \approx 1.7\cdot10^{1872344071119348}</math> is the sum of a prime and a product of at most two primes.
===Twin prime conjecture=== [[Yitang Zhang]]<ref>Yitang Zhang, [http://annals.math.princeton.edu/2014/179-3/p07 Bounded gaps between primes], ''Annals of Mathematics'' '''179''' (2014), pp. 1121–1174 from Volume 179 (2014), Issue 3</ref> showed that there are infinitely many prime pairs with gap bounded by 70 million, and this result has been improved to gaps of length 246 by a collaborative effort of the [[Polymath Project]].<ref>{{cite journal | author=D.H.J. Polymath | title=Variants of the Selberg sieve, and bounded intervals containing many primes | journal=Research in the Mathematical Sciences | volume=1 | number=12 | doi=10.1186/s40687-014-0012-7 | arxiv=1407.4897 | year=2014 | mr=3373710 | page=12}}</ref> Under the generalized [[Elliott–Halberstam conjecture]] this was improved to 6, extending earlier work by [[James Maynard (mathematician)|Maynard]]<ref>J. Maynard (2015), [https://arxiv.org/abs/1311.4600 Small gaps between primes]. ''Annals of Mathematics'' '''181'''(1): 383-413.</ref> and [[Daniel Goldston|Goldston]], [[János Pintz|Pintz]] & [[Cem Yıldırım|Yıldırım]].<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Alan Goldston | first1 = Daniel | last2 = Motohashi | first2 = Yoichi | last3 = Pintz | first3 = János | last4 = Yalçın Yıldırım | first4 = Cem | year = 2006 | title = Small Gaps between Primes Exist | url = http://projecteuclid.org/DPubS?service=UI&version=1.0&verb=Display&handle=euclid.pja/1146576181 | journal = Proceedings of the Japan Academy, Series A Mathematical Sciences | volume = 82 | issue = 4| pages = 61–65 | doi=10.3792/pjaa.82.61}}</ref>
[[Chen Jingrun|Chen]] showed that there are infinitely many primes ''p'' (later called [[Chen prime]]s) such that ''p''+2 is either a prime or a semiprime.
===Legendre's conjecture=== It suffices to check that each prime gap starting at ''p'' is smaller than <math>2 \sqrt p</math>. A table of maximal prime gaps shows that the conjecture holds to 4×10<sup>18</sup>.<ref>Jens Kruse Andersen, [http://primerecords.dk/primegaps/maximal.htm Maximal Prime Gaps].</ref> A counterexample near 10<sup>18</sup> would require a prime gap fifty million times the size of the average gap. Matomäki shows that there are at most <math>x^{1/6}</math> exceptional primes followed by gaps larger than <math>\sqrt{2p}</math>; in particular, :<math>\sum_{\stackrel{p_{n+1}-p_n>x^{1/2}}{x\le p_n\le 2x}}p_{n+1}-p_n\ll x^{2/3}.</math><ref>{{cite journal|author=Kaisa Matomäki|title=Large differences between consecutive primes|journal=Quarterly Journal of Mathematics|volume=58|year=2007|pages=489–518|doi=10.1093/qmath/ham021}}.</ref>
A result due to [[Albert Ingham|Ingham]] shows that there is a prime between <math>n^3</math> and <math>(n+1)^3</math> for every large enough ''n''.<ref>{{cite journal |first=A. E. |last=Ingham |title=On the difference between consecutive primes |journal=Quarterly Journal of Mathematics Oxford |volume=8 |year=1937 |issue=1 |pages=255–266 |doi=10.1093/qmath/os-8.1.255 |bibcode=1937QJMat...8..255I }}</ref>
===Near-square primes=== Landau's fourth problem asked whether there are infinitely many primes which are of the form <math>p=n^2+1</math> for integer ''n''. (The list of such primes is {{OEIS|id=A002496}}.) The existence of infinitely many such primes would follow as a consequence of other number-theoretic conjectures such as the [[Bunyakovsky conjecture]] and [[Bateman–Horn conjecture]]. {{As of|2018}}, this problem is open.
One example of near-square primes are [[Fermat primes]]. [[Henryk Iwaniec]] showed that there are infinitely many numbers of the form <math>n^2+1</math> with at most two prime factors.<ref>{{cite journal |first=H. |last=Iwaniec|title=Almost-primes represented by quadratic polynomials|journal=[[Inventiones Mathematicae]] |volume=47 |issue=2 |year=1978|pages=178–188 |doi=10.1007/BF01578070 |bibcode=1978InMat..47..171I}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|author=Robert J. Lemke Oliver|title=Almost-primes represented by quadratic polynomials|journal=Acta Arithmetica|volume=151|issue=3|year=2012|pages=241–261|url=http://www.stanford.edu/~rjlo/papers/04-Quadratic.pdf|doi=10.4064/aa151-3-2}}.</ref> [[Nesmith Ankeny]] proved that, assuming the [[extended Riemann hypothesis]] for [[L-function]]s on [[Hecke character]]s, there are infinitely many primes of the form <math>x^2+y^2</math> with <math>y=O(\log x)</math>.<ref>[[Nesmith Ankeny|N. C. Ankeny]], Representations of primes by quadratic forms, Amer. J. Math. 74:4 (1952), pp. 913–919.</ref> Landau's conjecture is for the stronger <math>y=1</math>.
Deshouillers and Iwaniec,<ref>Jean-Marc Deshouillers and Henryk Iwaniec, [https://eudml.org/doc/74560 On the greatest prime factor of <math>n^2+1</math>], ''Annales de l'institut Fourier'' '''32''':4 (1982), pp. 1–11.</ref> improving on Hooley<ref>C. Hooley, On the greatest prime factor of a quadratic polynomial, Acta Math., 117 ( 196 7), 281-299.</ref> and Todd,<ref>{{citation|author=J. Todd|title=A problem on arc tangent relations|journal=American Mathematical Monthly |volume=56 |issue=8 |year=1949 |pages=517–528 |doi=10.2307/2305526 |jstor=2305526}}</ref> showed that there are infinitely many numbers of the form <math>n^2+1</math> with greatest prime factor at least <math>n^{1.2}</math>. Replacing the exponent with 2 would yield Landau's conjecture.
The [[Brun sieve]] establishes an upper bound on the density of primes having the form <math>p=n^2+1</math>: there are <math>O(\sqrt x/\log x)</math> such primes up to <math>x</math>. It then follows that [[almost all]] numbers of the form n<sup>2</sup>+1 are composite. <!-- Banks, Friedlander, Pomerance, & Shparlinski show that there are infinitely many squarefree ''n'' for which φ(''n'') is a square. Replacing "squarefree" with "prime" would yield the conjecture. -->

  1. Mineralogic phenomena
  2. [[Lithology|Lithologic]] phenomena
    1. [[Petrology|Rock types]]
      1. [[Igneous rock]]
        • Igneous formation processes
      2. [[Sedimentary rock]]
        • [[Sediment#Formation|Sedimentary formation]] processes ([[sediment|sedimentation]])
        • [[Quicksand]]
      3. [[Metamorphic rock]]
  3. [[Endogeny|Endogenic]] phenomena
    1. [[Plate tectonics]]
      1. [[Continental drift]]
      2. [[Earthquake]]
      3. [[Oceanic trench]]
    2. Phenomena associated with [[Igneous|igneous activity]]
      1. [[Geyser]]s and [[hot spring]]s
      2. [[Bradyseism]]
      3. [[Volcano|Volcanic eruption]]
    3. [[Earth's magnetic field]]
  4. [[Exogeny|Exogenic]] phenomena
    1. Slope phenomena
      1. [[Slump (geology)|Slump]]
      2. [[Landslide]]
    2. [[Weathering]] phenomena
      1. [[Erosion]]
    3. [[Glacier|Glacial]] and peri-glacial phenomena
      1. [[Glaciation]]
      2. [[Moraine]]s
      3. [[Hanging valley]]s
    4. [[Atmosphere|Atmospheric]] phenomena
    5. Impact phenomena
      1. [[Impact crater]]
  5. Coupled endogenic-exogenic phenomena
    1. [[Orogeny]]
    2. [[Drainage]] development
      1. [[Stream capture]]
